The event system will segfault if an event callback removes a connection. See the updates to `Event_TEST.cc` for more info. This problem is related to https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/331

I've included a small change to the ElevatorPlugin, which is needed by ROCON.

[Homebrew clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/347/)

[Nvidia clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/358/testReport/)

update.description:
The event system will segfault if an event callback removes a connection. See the updates to `Event_TEST.cc` for more info. This problem is related to https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/331

I've included a small change to the ElevatorPlugin, which is needed by ROCON.

[No gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/448/)

[Homebrew clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/347/)

[Nvidia clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/358/testReport/)
update.title: Fix event segfault

content.html: I'm giving it a final check. Nate, could you please fix the conflict?

content.raw:
on OS X, gzclient seg-faults ([full backtrace here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/3013a670e28cfd0027dc)):

~~~
* thread #1: tid = 0xaf4ce, 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x80)
    frame #0: 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487
   484 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////
   485 	void Visual::Update()
   486 	{
-> 487 	  if (!this->dataPtr->visible)
   488 	    return;
   489 	
   490 	  std::list<DynamicLines*>::iterator iter;
(lldb) bt
* thread #1: tid = 0xaf4ce, 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x80)
  * frame #0: 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487
    frame #1: 0x00000001000720df libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::Signal() [inlined] boost::function0<void>::operator()() const + 95 at function_template.hpp:772
    frame #2: 0x00000001000720c5 libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::Signal(this=<unavailable>) + 69 at Event.hh:341
    frame #3: 0x0000000100069a98 libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::gui::GLWidget::paintEvent(QPaintEvent*) [inlined] gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::operator(this=<unavailable>)() + 56 at Event.hh:187
    frame #4: 0x0000000100069a8c libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::gui::GLWidget::paintEvent(this=0x00000001068b3000, _e=0x00007fff5fbf94b0) + 44 at GLWidget.cc:272

content.html:
on OS X, gzclient seg-faults (full backtrace here):

* thread #1: tid = 0xaf4ce, 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x80)
    frame #0: 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487
   484  //////////////////////////////////////////////////
   485  void Visual::Update()
   486  {
-> 487    if (!this->dataPtr->visible)
   488      return;
   489  
   490    std::list<DynamicLines*>::iterator iter;
(lldb) bt
* thread #1: tid = 0xaf4ce, 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x80)
  * frame #0: 0x000000010160ce58 libgazebo_rendering.6.dylib`gazebo::rendering::Visual::Update(this=0x0000000121eb7b80) + 24 at Visual.cc:487
    frame #1: 0x00000001000720df libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::Signal() [inlined] boost::function0<void>::operator()() const + 95 at function_template.hpp:772
    frame #2: 0x00000001000720c5 libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::Signal(this=<unavailable>) + 69 at Event.hh:341
    frame #3: 0x0000000100069a98 libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::gui::GLWidget::paintEvent(QPaintEvent*) [inlined] gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::operator(this=<unavailable>)() + 56 at Event.hh:187
    frame #4: 0x0000000100069a8c libgazebo_gui.6.dylib`gazebo::gui::GLWidget::paintEvent(this=0x00000001068b3000, _e=0x00007fff5fbf94b0) + 44 at GLWidget.cc:272

content.html: I can reproduce the problem. You can also insert a sphere and then delete it to cause the problem.

content.html: There's a big section of commented code right here (starting with "Make sure we can get a lock"). Is it needed?

content.raw:
The test is working for me. Playing with PR2 seems to be working as expected. So I would consider Events changes valid.

For the elevator: gazebo is exiting suddenly (gdb does not display any error, just exiting) if I do the following:

 * Create an sphere in front of the door. The doors are open.
 * Create an sphere inside the elevator
 * Remove the first sphere.
 * Gazebo exits.

Is it a problem on my end or you can reproduce it?
content.html:
The test is working for me. Playing with PR2 seems to be working as expected. So I would consider Events changes valid.

For the elevator: gazebo is exiting suddenly (gdb does not display any error, just exiting) if I do the following:

  • Create an sphere in front of the door. The doors are open.
  • Create an sphere inside the elevator
  • Remove the first sphere.
  • Gazebo exits.

Is it a problem on my end or you can reproduce it?
